greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is k-n for the least k >= n+(A020639(n)-1) such that n-k and n-(sigma(n)-k) are relatively prime, or 0 if no such k <= sigma(n) exists.
comment: By definition, if n is neither an odd prime nor an odd perfect number, then a(n) >= (A020639(n)-1).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: a(n) = (A325961(n) - A325962(n)) / 2, assuming no odd perfect numbers exist.
xref: Cf. A006005 (positions of zeros, provided no odd perfect numbers exist).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 29 2019
